paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted BRCA2 variants and penetrance data from a study on breast cancer patients.

functional_data.summary: This variant involves the deletion of one nucleotide containing a thymine (T) in the BRCA2 exon 10, causing a frameshift resulting in the change of a Leucine with a Histidine at codon 413, formation of a premature termination codon and loss of the normal protein function.

variants.segregation_data: Detected in a total of 15 PV carriers (eight probands and seven family members).
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on family segregation and functional impact.
variants.additional_notes: No BRCA1 PV was observed in patients harboring Luminal A molecular subtypes.
key_quotes: The most frequent PV identified in most of the analyzed BRCA1-positive TNBCs is named BRCA2-1466delT (HGVS nomenclature: c.1238del; p.Leu413fs), was observed in the BRCA2 gene of LB molecular subtypes and detected in a total of 15 PV carriers (eight probands and seven family members).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
